name: Email Fetcher
description: Fetches emails from an IMAP server and returns their subject, date, sender, and text content.
author: Shinkai

imap_server.description: The IMAP server address (e.g., 'imap.gmail.com' for Gmail). For a list of common IMAP servers, see <https://www.systoolsgroup.com/imap/>

username.description: The username for the IMAP account (typically your email address)

password.description: The password for the IMAP account. For services like Gmail, you might need to use an app password instead of your regular password. Learn more at <https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/185833>

port.description: The port number for the IMAP server. The default is 993 for IMAPS (IMAP over SSL), while standard IMAP uses port 143

ssl.description: Whether to use SSL for the IMAP connection. Most modern IMAP servers require SSL for security

from_date.description: The start date for the email search (optional)

to_date.description: The end date for the email search (optional)

date.description: The date and time the email was sent

text.description: The text content of the email

login_status.description: Indicates if login was successful or not
